q: standing by Gabrielle Giffords ' hospital bed when her left eye fluttered open. Her right eye was damaged and is still bandaged. "PROUD OF HER" Kirsten Gillibrand told reporters the congresswomen were telling Gabrielle Giffords how proud we were of her and how she was inspiring the whole nation with her courage and with her strength. And then Debbie Wasserman Schultz and I started joking about all the things we were going to do after she got better. in Iraq has been worth the cost and remains largely unapologetic about his handling of the conflict, the Washington Post reported on Wednesday. Had the government of Saddam Hussein remained in power the Middle East would be far more perilous than it is today, Donald Rumsfeld wrote in his 800-page memoir, scheduled for release on Tuesday. Sergio Marchionne also reminded employees that it was with the assistance of the federal government of Ontario that Chrysler has been given an opportunity to create a future. Chrysler Group owes a deep debt of gratitude to taxpayers in Canada and the U.S. for the loans that enabled a reenergized, restructured company to emerge in June 2009, said Sergio Marchionne . , well-known egyptologist Zahi Hawass , on Thursday played down accounts of the break-in at the Museum and warned against "rumours." In a posting on his blog, Zahi Hawass said the incident at the museum resulted in 70 broken objects, all of which can be restored. I think truck sales will be defined by the price of oil, the price of gasoline, GM's Mr Akerson says. Cynthia Jones says pickup trucks remain very popular "If there's a spike in the price of gasoline, I think it will affect the heavy end of the market."

his time as editor of a Sunday tabloid. In his own version of Alastair Campbell 's dictum, Andy Coulson quit 10 Downing Street on Friday morning in a bid to spare his boss further embarrassment, declaring: When a spokesman needs a spokesman, it's time to move on.
